[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPiGrU75-QpwLezCb8UxIVCEdUijG6RVzyqUMBx=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipOAHo0hyl_KBimoGAhDEvf1G81i_OLedxBPVYb7=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipND7X2_rgswxgVHBCjTrZVuMj70t4phCSs3PIhh=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipPMG4UCdJRYINR2Au2wOQgD_KcXWu37i6rkeVQj=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]< /pictures>
<user>103891611723229736027</user><text>I got the thai basil gimlet to drink, the seafood hot and sweet basil as an entree, and the fried calamari as an appetizer. I seriously love basil, and all the dishes delivered! Everything was amazing. The calamari, served with a sweet dipping sauce and carrots fried in the same manner, was perfectly crunchy while being light on the batter and oil; it was seriously perfect, I can't say I've had better! The seafood basil entree was perfect too! It came with all varieties of seafood; white fish, shrimp, clam, and a mussel, served with basil and sliced peppers. The sauce absolutely delivered on the name, being spicy and sweet, salty with a hint of brown sugar. I poured my rice in to the bowl and ate it all up. I ate the salad last, lettuce and carrot in a sweet clear dressing. The drink was heavy on the basil, sweet and savory, I'm not one to describe alcohol well but it hit the spot! I'll be back before I leave town for sure!< /text>< Rating>

<review>The BEST Burmese I've ever had! No reservations, an hour+ wait, always busy... But well worth it!!!<//review><pictures>None<//pictures><response>None< /response><GmapID>0x80dd3630880e86c9:0xa82914858feac7f0< /GmapID></record>
</dataset><record>
< UserId.>
102272456959463623610< /UserId.>
<Name>Steven Suarez</Name><time>1533051419798<//time><rating>5< /rating>< review>
I went to this place on a whim and I walked out a very, very satisfied and happy customer.

In terms of decorations, there is not a lot, but what it does use gives the place a very unique atmosphere. It's not overly bright, not is it too dark. If you so wish, they offer seating outside as well.

The food here was absolutely amazing! Let's start with the strawberry lemonade. Not only was it tasty, citrusy, and very refreshing, but it was also refillable for free! That alone is awesome, but then I was served my food and I almost forgot about the lemonade because I was met with an explosion of flavors from every item on plate. Explosion may conjure a sense of really strong and overpowering tatstes. That was not the case here. Everything blended together in harmony accentuating what makes each ingredient unique. The sticky rice went so well with the sauce that they provided.

If you want to go on a journey of flavors, this place is for you and you can rest assure knowing that the service is just as good.</review>

<gmapID>0x80dd3630880e86c9:0xa82914858feac7f0<//gmapID><user_name>Katherine Phillips< /user_name>< rate>
5< /rate>
<review>This is a nice little place down the street from the Warner theater my friend and I visited.

The wait staff was incredible and if I had more money to give as a tip I would have given more.

I ordered the green curry, added bamboo shoots and asked for it to be spicy.

They brought out the curry in this beautifully exotic bowl that looked a bit like a tiny bathtub. It was green as advertised and when I tasted my first spoonful an explosion of flavor and spice graced my tongue. The eggplant was moist and acted like a delicate sponge. The bamboo shoots were fantastically crunchy and the bell peppers brought a fantastic yet brief relief from the spice.

She brought me a side of Jasmine rice (my favorite) and adding the curry to that made the experience even more delightful.

Keep doing what you're doing Baramee you have a good thing going.< /review>< UserId.>

< Rate>
4<//Rate>
< date>
1488494179529<//date>
<response>None<//response>< text>
The food here is very good and the atmosphere is one of the best in small town San Pedro. Customer service is also really good. Ordered the beef and noodles, mixed veggies with shrimp and Thai boxing chicken. Didn't care for the latter but the other two were good and enough for me and my two teenage children. I sat outside on the patio and had them turn on the propane heater. Another patron had her dog on the patio so nice to know dog-friendly as well. I ordered a new drink on the menu, Thai basil martini and it was delish. Even with three dishes, one including shrimp and a drink, bill about $50. I was thrilled. I often order delivery from them but I like the atmosphere here.</text>

We pride ourselves on having great customer service for ALL customers and that is clearly passed from me, to all my employees.\n\n#4 "No wheelchair Access" - Our Business has been here since 1953.  We have had the same entrance for more than 40 years.  It has not changed - though it does meet the minimums for ADA compliance and has the minimum required width, and no steps to enter.  Either way, we readily accommodate any person needing special assistance.  Additionally, we hold special Veteran\'s classes here for those that may have lost a limb in service.  Our Instructor, Melvin Pasley, brings Veterans to our shop to learn to dive or just for the experience / therapy.  We make every accommodation to make the experience a positive one. < user_name>
Bradley D. Thornton< /user_name>
<Date>1486580643628<//Date><Rating>5<//Rating>< Review>
I miss the gigantic polar bear that used to adorn the shop. Being a longtime SCUBA instructor, I decided to pop in and just check out the shop, only to discover that it was no longer a general sporting goods store - no bows or firearms related accessories, kayaking/biking or other sporting activity hardware or apparel - just SCUBA diving.

This may disappoint some who remember Pacific Wilderness as a sporting goods store, but one of their primary focuses was always diving and the support of underwater photography, spearfishing, and SCUBA diving. This has not changed. The role has only expanded and in fact, it's now a full blown diving shop only, and I found this refreshing, because all too often, mixing various sports together results in a shop that is incomplete in its offerings for each of the sporting disciplines.

Not only is Pacific a well stocked diving shop, with fill stations and attentive staff along with a complete line of many of the leading brands you expect; they also offer repair and regulator services, have their own onsite pool for classes with changing rooms and lockers.

Pacific Wildnerness is a PADI certification facility, which is fine, although it would be nice to see additional organizations like LA County and NAUI also represented as available programs as well.

I highly recommend.<//Review>

None< /Pics>

< user>
105580189855736318564</user>
<username>Ron Bolander</username><date>1360050577522< /date>< Rate>
5<//Rate>
< Text>
It's like going back in time to when your dad took you in to the old time barber shop.  Haircuts take about 35-45 minutes and are done excellently. You can smell the Pinaud  aftershave dabbed on after the back of your neck is shaved to your liking by a real barber.

It is a savored experience that cannot be rushed, very unlike a beauty salon like SuperCuts or other chain store "hair cutters".  When I went to those other places I was always impatient to get in and get out.  Here may take you as long or longer, but you don't mind the time.  When it is your turn you are treated like a king.

They have the right barber for whatever style you desire.  You have to try it!< /Text>
<pics>None< /pics>< Resp>
None<//Resp>

< Text>
Its a nice expensive! Definetly for the family and frinds. Everyone its friendly and you will have a good time. Theres a lot of traditilnal food such as en hiladas, pozole, menudo, huaraches, tlacoyos, pambazos, carrnitas, puerco ahumado, barbacoa tacos, handmade and freshmade quesadillas(the real ones) tacos of many kinds, desserts! Atole, tostilocos, yogurt, icecream, churros, candy, gummies.....etc. this was the 3rd time i come and i notice a big increase in prices( pretty sad about it) in less than 1 moth prices on must stuff went up about $2.00. I would recomend this place. Remeber its every friday!< /Text>

<Rate>5< /Rate></record></dataset><record>
<Name>Vanny D<//Name>< text>
La Puente live is a really cool event. It takes place every Friday and each event offers up different music.  And if course space for dancing.  It's a really nice event to take the family. It feels very small town.  I like that.
There's a nice variety of vendors.... from tupperware to make-up to clothing to home goods.  Every Friday brings something new.  And train ride for the little one. I love the fact you can just sit and indulge in people watching.  This is a bring your own chair event. Get the early... setup your chair walk the venue get your food and then sit and enjoy.
I definitely will be participating again.</text>

< userid>
104581666364747365732< /userid>
<Name>Yvette Tung</Name>< time>
1525983163176< /time>
<Rate>4< /Rate>< Review>
Don't need to drive 3 hours to go to Mexico. Just come to La Puente Friday nights for a little taste.

It's more like a night market where the majority of the vendors are for food -- just the way I like it! My favorites are Quesadilla Chile with homemade tortillas ($5), the barbacoa tacos across from that ($2), elote ($3), and the freshly made churros ($5). While the churros are a must, I wish they had smaller portions for less. It's just way too much for 2 people.

I could count on one hand the total number of non-Latinos at the event (us 2 included). With that said, most vendors can speak English as well, so don't worry about ordering. Of course, they were also nice when I was trying out my high school Spanish!

The event starts around 6pm. There's also live music starting around 7pm. Bring your own chairs to enjoy the music. Plenty of free street and lot parking within a short 1-3 minute walk.<//Review>
<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< resp>
None<//resp>

< text>
I don't typically write reviews but my pedicure experience was so bad I literally left and went to another salon for my manicure. I was offered a menu of pedicure options when I first arrived. I asked which ones come with a longer foot and leg massage since I was treating myself after a long work week. The pedicure I selected was $40. I was unimpressed with the massage, it was more like I was being pet... and the hot stone was uncomfortable because it wasn't being used properly. (I've had amazing and relaxing hot stone massages before). They attempted to skip removing any callus.. I had to remind and ask multiple times to have this done (isn't it included in a base pedicure... much less an upgraded one?) In the end, I had to have my toes repainted because the first was streaky and patchy. While they attempted to fix the mistakes... I ended up being there for 2 hours with a mediocre and stressful experience. When I asked them about the lack of detail cleaning up my cuticles/callus I was told.... it looks like that because my skin is dry. (Um.. that's why I'm getting a pedicure).

That's when I said I would like to leave and no longer get my manicure. When I was checking out they attempted to charge me $50 instead of the $40 option I chose. With insistence they did say that they would only charge $40.

I'm most disappointed because I was looking forward to this for 2 weeks and I rarely treat myself like this.

The one star that is given goes to the chair massage. Because that was the only pleasant part of the experience.</text>

< text>
My daughter and I spent spring break at Palm Mountain Resort and Spa.  We loved it!  We didn't rent a car as the hotel has a free shuttle to and from the airport.  Many restaurants and shops are located on Palm Canyon Drive which is within a block of the resort so we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. We felt safe while walking.  The pool and hot tub were awesome!  We were always able to get a lounge chair - no matter what time of the day we went to the pool. Our room had a balcony overlooking the pool which we enjoyed.  Our room was clean and we had no concerns. Each room has a safe which is nice to have.  We will be going back!</text>

The photos do not show the reality of the hotel. Upgrades are extremely necessary - the bedding was torn, the room smelled musty, very dim light, old furniture. The outside looks nice - pool + palm trees, but the inside felt like a huge disappointment.

Unfortunately the customer service wasnâ€™t great either. The front desk seemed stressed and wasnâ€™t very kind or helpful. They were actually quite cold which was not a pleasant start to our trip after hours on the road. We also had to wait an hour to check in - and they told us they would notify us but they never did so we came back after killing some time to make sure we werenâ€™t forgotten.

We also requested blankets every night because it was chilly and the beds only a sheet on them - possibly due to covid? - but it took quite a while (40 min) to receive our blankets. One night the blanket was actually seemed very sticky, rough, and didnâ€™t feel fresh so we had to ask for another one.

The key cards didnâ€™t work to enter the propertyâ€™s gate so we had to either wait for people to walk by one night and we called security the second night of our stay.

We also werenâ€™t the only people who had a disappointing experience. A couple  - who opened the door for us when we were locked out - expressed to us that they were not happy with customer service or their accommodations either. We thought our issues might have been a one-off but it seems that others also were unsatisfied.

We were really looking forward to our stay at Palm Mountain especially since we paid a decent amount for the holiday weekend and read some great reviews online - but we were completely underwhelmed with what we got. While Palm Springs was a nice getaway, this hotel was a huge pain point throughout the trip. Itâ€™s unfortunate that the more time we spent away from the hotel the better our experience was.

Two out of five.<//text>

<review>Nice resort walking distance to all of the restaurants, bars etc... Once in your room it states $25 fee for pool towels not returned. Also if you exit out of your room from patio entrance the door does not lock behind you. So if you plan of leaving for the day exit from front door. Friendly customer service. Various games to play. Corn hole, jenga etc... Pool is nice but small. You can have alcoholic beverages if they are in can or cup. Pretty much once you arrive at resort you don't need to worry about driving anywhere you are so close to everything. The pool stays open pretty late and opens early. The rooms are nice and include a microwave and small refrigerator. Pretty quiet rooms. <rate>3</rate><text>It's a 6.3 hotel if you're experienced. Adequate is the word. Location is 10/10.

But;

- no late checkout (COVID excuse)
- resort fees (lol)
- pool towels are tiny in room not at pool
- sagging banner at pool (no love or effort)
- bad wifi like not good
- rooms adequate but dated (thin walls)
- some lights in room didn't work
- front desk service just 'is'. Like a 6. Adequate. Yuck. Zero welcoming-ness about the staff. Seems like it's their job, not passion.

This place is lacking love. It's a 'resort' that just doesn't seem to care much. It rides on it's location. It's nothing special what so ever. If you're looking for the SPA refresh stay in Palm Springs look elsewear. This is not bad though either. Even the pool music had a radio advertisment come on, like what?! Some vanilla music channel, no pool vibe at all. Family place. Maybe the manager needs to get reinspired. Also yay I get to enjoy the pool a bit extra and drive home to LA covered in sweat ðŸ’¦ because they can't extend check-in an hr. Lame. Give back the resort fee then. COVID has become a major excuse for limiting effort I find. Lazy. Cleaners didn't get to my room to after 12 anyway.

This morning I asked for milk for cereal in lobby cantina receptionist didn't even look me in the eyes and to me to 'hold on' while who knows what she was doing instead. Felt like I was burdening her to stand up, I just told her to forget it and left. No one else was there. Ya, put some love here and fix service and it could get to a 7.x place. Maybe even high 7's. Put some money in to the dated patios and rooms, even an 8.x.

Wouldn't stay again at the moment. It's a 6.2 and a 6.5 due to location. So let's call it a 6.3.

And to be fair, if you're not fussy or particular or expecting much, or ever stay nicer palces, maybe you can make an argument it's a low 6.9 or 7, just not to me, it is. So calibrate your expectations accordingly.</text>< pictures>

<username>Toni Watson<//username><text>Nice staff at the front desk, beautiful lobby area, and the room like a cottage, very nice
room, and decor was spot on, classy place. It's too bad all the beauty and service
somewhat 'disappear' when you try to get into the swimming pool, who would want to?
The pool was packed, the pool party had very loud music (in a foreign language) loud
guests, the spots were saved with towels over chairs, you don't have a chance
to use the pool here, it spoiled the visit. The pool party went right up to 10:00 p.m. when

<userid>108178330266074066304< /userid>< Name>
wealwaysWAnder</Name>
<time>1510249481099</time><rate>4< /rate><Text>We have stayed here 2 years in a row now for our annual Mom - Daughter Desert Get away.  The location of this hotel is what makes it a standout in the area. Just steps (1 block) away from all the shops and restaurants of Palm Springs. We were able to walk to coffee in the morning, and dinner at night. Parking was easy to find at noon when we arrived on a Wed. We got the parking spot and never had to move the car until we left because the location is so good. Customer Service was great. The first year we arrived early and the room was not ready, but they let us change into our swimsuits and enjoy the pool. They called me as soon as the room was ready.  The second year we arrived at the same time, however the room was ready and for $20 extra we got to get into our room and settle in early.  The pool area is calm, not too many kids around making noise or splashing. They did have music, but the speakers were not very good and we could barely hear depending on where we were around the pool. I also had to ask them to turn it on one day. The pool was always clean and we never had to fight for chair space. The first year room (203) was perfect for us. Microwave and fridge allowed us to go buy snacks and drinks. We would eat breakfast on our balcony with coffee, and then take a pool break to our room for lunch (usually leftovers) and only dined out for dinner - making the trip even more affordable. The room was older, but it had charm like the slatted windows out to the balcony. The closet was big with mirrored doors so it made getting ready at night easy for 2 girls - no fighting for mirror space. The balcony was small with 2 chairs and a table, but it was perfect for enjoying coffee and breakfast in the morning. There was a grapefruit tree right off the balcony area - wish they were ripe! The bathroom was the area that could really use an update..... but it was sufficient for our needs.   This year our room was on the backside 3rd floor room 314.  These rooms were slightly bigger, but for the most part the same layout.  In the entry there was a funny small ledge but it worked out good for our drinks and snacks and stuff.  The biggest downside to this hotel is that it has no restaurant..... nothing!  They were in the process of adding a little store of some sort while i was there this time.  It really needs a little restaurant with bar where you can get something. Not really bad for us though because we got to enjoy restaurants every night instead. I would definitely stay here again, probably in Oct for the next girls trip!< /Text><pics>[{'url': <review>Spent a lovely three days at Palm Mountain Resort when I was in town for a conference. Would have loved to extend my stay to enjoy time at the hotel and take advantage of the resort and spa facilities.

Hotel is a 15 minute walk from the convention center and the hotel also made the shuttle van available for us. Complimentary van service is also available to and from airport during certain hours. Confirm availability when making reservations. Airport is less than 15 minutes away.

Rooms are comfortable. My only complaint was the mattress which was super firm. I was in a two bed room on the third floor facing the mountains. All rooms have some type of balcony or patio space with chairs available. Wall safe mounted at comfortable height in closet. Breakfast bar with coffee machine, microwave and mini fridge. Small table also provided in room.

Bathroom clean with plentiful hot water. Loved the scent of the provided soaps, lotions and gels.

Outside amenities, pool, hot tub and fire pit, comfortable and spacious. Pool was spotless. Hotel lobby had small seating areas with board games should you happen to have time to enjoy.

All the staff I interacted with were friendly, helpful, and accommodating.<//review><userid>105450274603581324192< /userid>< Time>
1572450370607</Time>

<review>We stayed at Palm Mountain Resort for 3 nights recently. The strongest feature of the hotel is its location. All of downtown is within walking distance giving access to numerous restaurants, bars and shopping.

The rooms are outdated with limited amenities. Each room is equipped with a mini-fridge, coffeemaker and microwave. In our room, the fridge was dead when we arrived. It was promptly replaced. The coffeemaker worked once and then died. It too was replaced.

The property was generally tidy and the room was clean. But the furnishings have definitely seen better days. The in-room air conditioner was clanky and noisy, though functional.

Due to COVID19, the bar and dining were suspended at the time of our stay.< /review><Pictures>None<//Pictures><Response>{'time': 1596154449581, 'text': "Thank you for choosing the Palm Mountain Resort and Spa on your recent visit. < username>
Frances Douglass< /username>
< Time>
1579022587554< /Time>
< Rating>
5</Rating>
<Text>Just got back.  Reading through the reviews, I can agree that the outdoor areas leading to the room are somewhat older and maybe a little run down, but it's a 60 year old building, which is part of what gives it a classic feel.  I wouldn't trade this beautiful property, well-kept, great light lobby area with indoor outdoor space to hang around, as well as a lovely heated pool and hot tub. The whole property is secured with locking gates, lovely paths and landscaping, and citrus trees (mostly grapefruit) that you can pluck from---or just take from the large basket offered in the lobby.  I totally disagree that the beds are uncomfortable, as in our room both queen beds were as comfy as they get with four pillows of all sizes on each bed to suit side or back sleepers.  The staff was wonderful, and how nice to have a place that kindly locks up your luggage until you come back to take the quick shuttle to the airport.  They also picked us up very promptly when we arrived.  The location is absolutely ideal--how nice to be able to walk easily to the most popular spots in Palm Springs--a vacation from your car!< /Text><Pictures>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNux_ptym_0o-vQUCyrRE-khbMnS0UGmUnvCkjg=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]< /Pictures><resp>{'time': 1580428263064, 'text': 'Thank you for choosing the Palm Mountain Resort and Spa on your recent visit. <text>I really enjoyed my stay. Fantastic location, walking distance to everything. The hotel has a chill, low-key vibe which is what I wanted. There is no "bar" or pool bar so it's not a noisy party place. Helpful staff, comfy rooms and nice amenities. I only remove one star for the spa. I got a prenatal massage and there is no way the massage therapist was "highly trained" or certified in prenatal massage like the description says. They claim they use special pillows to make you comfortable but they are regular pillows. I've had a "true" prenatal setup before and this wasn't it. My therapist didn't really know what she was doing. I've gotten many prenatal massages before and this was the worst. It was basically someone just putting lotion on me. She didn't know how to properly drape and my whole butt was hanging out at times, so awkward. I said I had sciatica pain and she did nothing to address it. < Rating>
4</Rating>
<Review>Location, location, location! Palm Mountain Resort & Spa is perfectly located in the heart of where the shopping and action is in Palm Springs. There are numerous clothing stores and eateries within walking distance (if you can stand the heat!), and if you happen to be in town on a Thursday night, the Village Fest (kind of like a huge farmer's market with almost 200 vendors) is right outside the hotel. My only complaints: the beds were a little small and uncomfortable, the decor of the rooms was a little dated, parking can be difficult if the hotel is at or close to capacity, and check-in is kind of late (4 PM). On the plus side, the staff is friendly, and the spa was fantastic as well (my wife and I got a couples massage). In my opinion, this hotel is worth it if you get a good deal.<//Review><Pics>None</Pics><Resp>{'time': 1531945361465, 'text': 'Wow, thank you for such a great review and rating.\n\nWe are so pleased you enjoyed your stay and the great location of the hotel.\n\nWe hope to see you again soon.\n\nTim - General Manager, Palm Mountain Resort & Spa'}</Resp>< Gmap_id>

<user_name>David Martinez</user_name><Text>Place was well kept. Grounds were nicely groomed, and the room that we stayed at was welcoming and clean (newer rooms?). <rating>2</rating><Text>If you're looking for location as the most important factor it's right downtown and we walked there everyday. but a good 15min drive from major stores or chain restaurant. <user_name>Lila Cruickshank Lahola< /user_name>< Date>
1510759373939< /Date>
< Rating>
4< /Rating>
< Review>
Nice place!!! Great rooms, great service and a fantastic shower! Our room had a mini fridge and microwave even though we didn't ask for one so I would assume all the rooms do. We also had a nice little patio outside with a seating area right outside our room and the courtyard was lovely with a large heated pool and hot tub and several fire pits to sit down by. The location is nice too with plenty of restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance. My only complaint was that there was no complimentary coffee in the lobby. Coffee is provided in the market place in the lobby for $2 a cup (small cup) which you can have charged to your room or you can walk one block to Starbucks and get a larger cup of the same coffee for the same price.</Review>

<Text>The location was ok. There was a lot of construction taking place directly across the street and at the adjacent corner. The grounds of the hotel were decent, and clean but out of date. The rooms were small, the bathrooms were dated. The soap, lotion and shampoo dispencers were kind of an odd feature. Good luck getting a smile from any of the staff, or any assistance for that matter. Asking fir extra towels was like asking for a bar of gold. Calling the front desk for information seemed to be an inconvenience to the concierge. Parking is difficult and nothing is conveniently close to your room. Over all, you get what you pay for and the "4 star resort" service that comes with it.< /Text>< user>

< name>
David McMillan< /name>
< rate>
3<//rate>
<Pics>None<//Pics>< Review>
Rooms are spacious with comfortable large beds. They have tea/coffee facilities, TV, fridge,  microwave and a bath with shower fitting. Free Wi-Fi is included. There's an outside swimming pool.
The facility is tired and need of refurbishment, the bedroom carpet is badly stained, the window leaks when it rains, air con is very noisy etc.
Breakfast is "included" but turns out to be a $3 voucher for Ruby's Diner, which is 200 yards away.
So it's fine for basic accommodation but no more.</Review>

< user>
105452454024658372853<//user>
<user_name>Martin Barshai<//user_name><time>1510602286563</time>< Rating>
1< /Rating>
< review>
This review has been a long time in the making. We stayed as guests in May 2017. During our last night, someone broke into our hotel room and STOLE EVERYTHING we owned. Including: laptops, hard drives, guitar, clothes, wallet, car and house keys, credit cards, cash. It was $6,444 altogether. This was due in large part to the LACK OF SECURITY at the hotel. They have no video cameras around the resort, only in the lobby. They don't have security guards. And it is incredibly easy to sneak in or out of one of their many un-monitored entrances.

By the way, we WERE NOT THE FIRST TO GET ROBBED THERE. Check their yelp page's 1 star reviews, which there are MORE of than any other star rating: there's a review from 2014 of a guy who was robbed there with his WIFE: I actually got in touch with him, David L., and he had the exact same experience as we did. The hotel did not care. And it was clearly someone with access to rooms who had robbed him, as we know is the case for us too, which we can't prove because they don't have cameras in most places and they DELETED the lobby's footage from the night we were robbed. Uh-huh. They also denied showing us an employee list from the night we robbed. There's just too much fishy stuff going on at this place.

The hotel was ROBBED AGAIN, later this summer 2017, at gun point in their lobby. There is a news article about this online you can google.

Also, one last thing, we tried to speak to the general manager, Tim Ellis, after getting robbed but he didn't return any of our calls nor did the email provided to us for him work.

BELIEVE ALL THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS. They are true about his place. Palm Mountain mis-represents everything on their site. Their rooms are old and do have a strange smell. There are bugs. There is very loud construction next door. Their staff were extremely unfriendly and unaccommodating -- straight up blaming us for being the victims of a robbery. The experience I had at this resort changed me as a person. Made me realize how little a corporation like Columbia Hospitality actually cares about their customers. Made me realize a fundamental truth about humanity: at the end of the day, businesses just want your money.< /review>

< Review>
Make no mistake, the location is great.  Really right there downtown but one street off the main drag, so it's quiet.  HOWEVER, we were upset that when we arrived, we were told there was an $80 resort charge and they wouldn't let us check in (although the room was already paid for through expedia) without forking over the cash.  The room had terrible mattresses.  One of the beds was so bad that it actually had indentations where people slept on it.  You know, the mound in the middle thing.  Cheap details like no extra soap.  To use bar soap I had to change from the sink to the tub.  Ugh. Carpet was dingy, possibly just dirty, but worn nevertheless. There wasn't even a picture on the wall in either of the two rooms I purchased.  The photos on the website must be of some upscale room they keep hidden.  Front desk was sullen.  Overall, disappointing.  I won't stay there again.<//Review>

<user_name>Jason Stone</user_name>< Time>
1427060304885< /Time>
<Rate>4</Rate>< user_id>
112321590320460794569</user_id>
<Pictures>None<//Pictures>< gmapID>
0x80db1ba5967e997b:0x2ea7360171a38fa2< /gmapID>
< resp>
None<//resp>
< review>
I booked this despite the bad reviews because everything else was sold out during the IW tennis tourney in March 2015.  We had low expectations, but were very pleasantly surprised.  They are under construction, so the check-in was in a temporary structure and no lobby, but otherwise the place was updated, comfortably laid out, and well maintained.  Room was updated with new beds, very comfortable.  New granite shower and sink had been installed in the older bathroom.   Nice patio with chairs within a 30 foot walk to the pool.    Pool was perfectly maintained, as was the hot tub.  Fresh towels placed on every lounge chair in the AM by the pool.  And working fireplaces with adirondack chairs where people gathered in the central area at night.   Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was prepaid and there were no extra charges.   Location is great if you want to be near the main walking area of Palm Springs.    Maybe the parking was a bit inconvenient, as the lot outside the room was full, so we had to park across the street.

Maybe they improved fast before I got there, but I saw nothing to justify the awful reviews.   If I needed a nice convenient place, I'd stay there again.< /review>
</record>

< review>
Do NOT book in this resort if you're planning a family vacation! The staff here are EXTREMELY RUDE! A few of the kids from our family were in the pool playing and someone went to go complain to the front desk that they were being "too loud". The front desk sent their janitor to go yell at the kids. He told them to shut up and that next time he comes he's kicking them out. The fact that he was yelling and screaming at children that aren't his in the first place, is a sign that the staff in this resort are unprofessional. When the janitor came back again, he almost made on of the kids cry! So we went to go tell management that we don't want this strange man yelling at the kids for playing too much in the pool! Those kids have parents and the janitor should've gone to the children's parents first! And secondly, it's a POOL! Kids are supposed to have fun and play in a pool! It's normal for children to make noise and play in a pool! And children should not be reprimanded for that! And third of all, the resort had employees in the pool who were drinking beer and there was also a lot of other adults drinking beer and alcohol in the pool area! Those employees should be the ones to be reprimanded for drinking in a pool area! Overall, this resort is the worst resort I've ever been in. I do NOT recommend for anyone with children to stay here; better yet, I don't recommend for anyone at all to stay here. The staff are rude and unprofessional. Stay away from this place!< /review>

<Review>Really nice, centrally located in downtown PS. Everything is pretty much walking distance from the hotel. Restaurants/bars etc. Can't beat the location. Property seems to have been upgraded a bit in the last year or so. New outdoor fire pit and lounge area at the pool. Really nice! Also, a new outdooor lounge area up front adjacent to the main entrance. Also really nice! Our ground floor room was just steps from their heated pool. Room was super clean. Large king bed with super soft linen. Its been almost 2 years since we've stayed here and all these new suttle upgrades has really helped the property! Also, pool area very large with lots of area to get your suntan on!! LOL Great spa/jacuzzi too! Think this is our new go to spot in PS!!< /Review>< pics>

The one thing that stood our of course was the NO BIKES IN ROOM rule, but given the event that was going on they made an exception for my bike. For the price we thought we would have gotten a cleaner room. The room was bare like something you would see in the middle of nowhere and dusty. Behind the dresser was a pasts guests dirty laundry something you could see right when you walked in. The TV Channels where all fuzzy and there were only a few to choose from. We did love the location and the grounds were very pretty. We were only a short walk to the Start/Finish line and all the great food Palm Springs has to offer. <Text>If you decide to stay after you get past the gulag staff up front, you'll probably be even further disappointed with the accommodations. Not just old, but smelly. We were stuck in #237.....inside corner unit.  Hotel has no resort feel whatsoever. We used a Groupon method of reserving a $74 room.....ended up being $130 a night including "fees". Oh....the bed!!! King bed was like laying on a sheet of plywood. Tiny single sink bathroom.....whoever or whatever has been reviewing this property as a 3-star hotel is nuts. After day 2 of a 4-day stay we had enough. We skipped out and went back home to Temecula and enjoyed home as never before. < user_name>
david levin<//user_name>
<Date>1401333776118<//Date><Rating>1< /Rating><Review>I have to start by saying this is the worst hotel experience I have ever had. My wife and I chose to stay here because of its location in Downtown Palm Springs. The room was nothing special. The pool area was nice.  The second night we were there we went to dinner at 6:20pm and when we returned at 8:40pm our room had been burglarized.  There are 119 rooms at the hotel and we were the only guest room this happened to.  We were on the third floor overlooking the pool. There was no forced entry and the crooks took my laptop, smartphone, ipod, etc and stole my wifeâ€™s purse with her wallet and credit cards. The crooks used the credit cards within minutes of stealing them at gas stations, CVS and RiteAid.
The miserable experience only got worse from there. When I went to the registration desk and told them what had happened they told me to fill out an incident report. I had to berate them into calling the police who didnâ€™t show up until two hours later.  The desk clerk was sympathetic, but took no ownership of the situation. The clerk told me that corporate would get a hold of me. That  was on Thursday night and if I had not followed up no one would have called me. The hotel manager was supposed to call me, but he never has. There was a nice lady named Jodi in accounting who I spoke with, but had no authority. I was finally able to contact someone to speak with from corporate (Pacific Hospitality Group out of San Diego) this Wednesday afternoon, six days later. He was extraordinarily condescending and rude and insinuated I had left my door open and it was my responsibility. He informed me he could do nothing until the police report was turned over to their insurance company and they evaluated the situation.
The corporate executive would take no responsibility for the event and offered no compensation in any form for our loss.  When I asked him why they had no cameras watching the hallways and outside portion of the property he informed me that they are not required to. I saw no security on premises and after 10pm there was only one person on the desk. This hotel is being targeted by professional criminals and I can only conclude that they were either tipped off by housekeeping as to the valuables left in our room or have the technical means to defeat the electronic door locks.
I would not stay at this hotel because I donâ€™t think it is safe (my opinion). I was fortunate that we were not in our room when the burglars entered our room. This hotel is being targeted by professional criminals and I can only conclude that they were either tipped off by housekeeping as to the valuables left in our room or have the technical means to defeat the electronic door locks.  I have stayed in Palm Springs many times and have never had any problems. Just last month we stayed at the Alcazar and had a very enjoyable experience. Nicer grounds and a better pool area. There are many better choices in the Downtown that my wife and I have stated at.<//Review><Pictures>None< /Pictures>< Response>
None</Response>
